message: As I press on, the scenery gradually changes around me.
The forest disappears and before long, I find myself walking through a gigantic warehouse.
The ceiling, walls, and floor are all heavy with rust.
Broken pieces of heavy chain hang from the ceiling and metal boxes are strewn about everywhere. It's eerie.
From time to time, I can hear the sound of water dripping. There's no other sound in the vast, empty space.
No matter how far I walk, it seems to go on forever. I can't even see the wall ahead.
The heat from before has vanished completely, but now there's a growing weariness in my legs.
I know it's all in my mind, but my legs feel like stones. Each step is progressively harder, as if I were walking through thick mud.
The clang of my feet on the metal floor echoes through my whole body.
It's like the space itself is trying to keep me out.
"Stay away," I feel I hear a voice say.
But I can't give up. I have to keep going.
The voice speaks again, this time a guttural whisper.
The words are in a foreign language. I don't know what they're saying, but they fill me with disquiet.
I feel sick. The whispers are wearing on my nerves, and the weight of my legs isn't helping.
Suddenly, a crow's screech bursts inside my ears. I hear the flapping of wings, but there's no bird to be seen.
How much longer can this place go on? As I walk farther, doors begin to appear to the sides.
But they're all rusted over and chained.
With each step... my despair grows.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Haa, haa, haa..."
But I keep walking, and just as I'm sure I can't take another step...
A wall blocks my path at last. There's a door directly in front of me.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Haa, haa... Ngh..."
I put my hands on the door, struggling to catch my breath. Mink... has to be on the other side.
Once I've stopped panting, I ease the door open.
